thread.title: Sports digest: Fever beats Lynx in WNBA Finals opener
thread.title_full: Sports digest: Fever beats Lynx in WNBA Finals opener

author: Associated Press
title: Sports digest: Fever beats Lynx in WNBA Finals opener
text:
Sports digest: Fever beats Lynx in WNBA Finals opener Associated Press Posted: 10/04/2015 07:50:06 PM PDT Updated: 10/04/2015 07:55:08 PM PDT Briann January scored 19 points, and the Indiana Fever stole home-court advantage in the WNBA Finals with a 75-69 victory over the Minnesota Lynx in Game 1 on Sunday in Minneapolis. 
Marissa Coleman added 16 points, and the Fever hit all 16 of its free throws in a rematch of the 2012 finals. Indiana won Game 1 of that series en route to the franchise's only title. 
"We just believe in one another," Fever coach Stephanie White said. "We trust one another, and we understand that no matter what happens through the course of a game, if we come together, we're going to put ourselves in a position to win." 
Maya Moore had 27 points and 12 rebounds, and Sylvia Fowles added 21 points and 11 rebounds for the Lynx. But Minnesota missed eight of 23 free throws and turned the ball over 15 times. 
"How do we lose that game?" Lynx coach Cheryl Reeve said after Minnesota held Indiana to 36 percent shooting. "We just didn't do the little things at key times." 
Game 2 in the best-of-five series is Tuesday night in Minneapolis. NBA Charlotte Hornets small forward Michael Kidd-Gilchrist has a dislocated right shoulder that could cost him several weeks and the start of the regular season, the Charlotte Observer reported. Kidd-Gilchrist was injured during an exhibition against the Magic in Orlando, Florida, on Saturday. Soccer David Texeira scored twice, and Kellyn Acosta added a second-half goal as host FC Dallas beat the Houston Dynamo 4-1 to become the first Western Conference team to clinch an MLS playoff spot. Advertisement 
Joao Plata and Luke Mulholland scored in the first half, and Real Salt Lake beat host Colorado 2-1 to eliminate the Rapids from the MLS playoff race. 
Raul Lopez Gomez scored on a penalty kick in the 74th minute, and defending Olympic champion Mexico beat Haiti 2-0 in Carson to wrap up a spot in the semifinals in CONCACAF qualifying for the 2016 Rio Games. Mexico will complete round-robin play against Honduras on Wednesday night in Commerce City, Colorado Golf Argentina's Emiliano Grillo made a 25-foot birdie putt on the final hole to win the Web.com Tour Finals-ending Web.Com Tour Championship in Ponte Vedra Beach, Florida. Grillo beat Chez Reavie by a stroke in the last of the four events that replaced PGA Tour qualifying school.
